Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Friday January 10), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for friday, january 10th. samsung is making waves with its latest announcement about a foldable smartphone set to debut at next month's tech expo in barcelona. the device promises to revolutionize mobile technology with its ultra-thin glass technology, which competitors have yet to match. samsung's launch could push other tech giants to expedite their foldable phone developments.

meanwhile, google is upping its ai game by acquiring a startup focused on machine learning. this strategic move highlights the company's commitment to solidifying its dominance in the artificial intelligence space, as it looks to integrate new capabilities across its vast portfolio of services. the startup's advanced algorithms promise significant improvements in search processes and personalized services.

shares of netflix are on the rise following the company's announcement of an exclusive partnership with a prominent film studio. the deal is set to bring a series of highly anticipated blockbusters to the streaming platform, potentially attracting millions of new subscribers and tightening netflix's grip on the market.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, january 10th. 

samsung is making headlines with its latest announcement about a foldable smartphone set to debut at next month's tech expo in barcelona. the new device promises to revolutionize mobile technology with its innovative ultra-thin glass technology, a feat competitors are still striving to achieve. this launch could accelerate the development schedules of other tech giants in the race to perfect foldable phones.

meanwhile, google is stepping up its ai capabilities through the acquisition of a startup specializing in machine learning. this strategic move underscores google's commitment to maintaining its stronghold in the artificial intelligence space as it seeks to integrate cutting-edge advancements across its diverse array of services. the startup's advanced algorithms are expected to significantly enhance search processes and personalize user experiences.

in other news, shares of netflix are on the rise following the company's announcement of an exclusive partnership with a leading film studio. this deal will bring a series of highly anticipated blockbusters to the streaming platform, potentially drawing millions of new subscribers and strengthening netflix's market position.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-192 Samsung's Foldable Future 📱, Google's Ai Ambitions 🤖, Netflix's Blockbuster Boost 🎬
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for friday, january 10th! here's what we're covering today:

  • samsung's foldable smartphone: announcement of a new foldable smartphone featuring ultra-thin glass technology, set to debut at the upcoming tech expo in barcelona. this innovation could influence tech giants in the race for foldable phones.
  • google's ai acquisition: google acquires a machine learning startup to boost ai capabilities, aiming to enhance search processes and personalize user experiences across its services.
  • netflix's exclusive partnership: netflix strikes a deal with a leading film studio to bring a series of anticipated blockbusters to its streaming platform, potentially attracting millions of new subscribers.

stay tuned for more updates on tomorrow's tech briefing!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image set in a sleek, futuristic cityscape during a vibrant sunset, where the sky transitions from a rich orange to deep indigo. in the foreground, a sophisticated, unfolded samsung foldable phone elegantly curves open, displaying a vast digital landscape of neural networks and artistic patterns, representing google's ai ambitions. this central element seamlessly extends into the background, where a lively outdoor cinema scene unfolds, featuring a large projection screen. on the screen, a montage of classic film reels plays, symbolizing netflix's blockbuster boost. around this scene, modern skyscrapers adorned with digital billboards glow with interactive elements, hinting at a tech-imbued world blending physical and digital realms. the combined composition immerses viewers in a harmonious vision of innovation and entertainment on the horizon
